fields.name: record_id
fields.title: Record ID
fields.description: The unique identifier for a record (row) in the PHI-base database.

fields.name: phi_id
fields.title: PHI ID
fields.description: An identifier corresponding to one gene of one pathogen from one publication.

fields.name: protein_id_source
fields.title: Protein ID source
fields.description: The source database for the protein identifier.

fields.name: protein_id
fields.title: Protein ID
fields.description: The unique identifier for the protein expressed by the pathogen gene. The identifier references a protein database (such as UniProtKB).

fields.name: gene_id_source
fields.title: Gene ID source
fields.description: The source database for the pathogen gene identifier.

fields.name: gene_id
fields.title: Gene ID
fields.description: The unique identifier for the pathogen gene, which references a genetic database (such as GenBank).

fields.name: sequence_strain
fields.title: Sequence strain
fields.description: The strain, isolate, subspecies, etc. of the pathogen for the gene sequence or protein sequence.

fields.name: gene
fields.title: Gene
fields.description: The gene name for the pathogen gene.

fields.name: chromosome_location
fields.title: Chromosome location
fields.description: The chromosome where the pathogen gene is located.

fields.name: gene_protein_modification
fields.title: Gene protein modification
fields.description: Specific modifications to the targeted pathogen protein or promoter, such as amino acid modification, promoter sequence modification, or domain swaps.

fields.name: modified_gene_protein_id
fields.title: Modified gene protein ID
fields.description: The unique identifier for the modified pathogen gene.

fields.name: interacting_partners
fields.title: Interacting partners
fields.description: Proteins or DNA elements within the pathogen that interact with the pathogen gene. Multiple values are delimited with a semicolon.

fields.name: interacting_partners_id
fields.title: Interacting partners ID
fields.description: The unique identifiers for the proteins or DNA elements within the pathogen that interact with the pathogen gene. Each identifier is prefixed with with the name of its source database. Multiple values are delimited with a semicolon.

fields.name: multiple_mutation
fields.title: Multiple mutation
fields.description: One or more PHI IDs for pathogen genes that are disrupted as part of a mutation. Multiple values are delimited with a semicolon.

fields.name: pathogen_id
fields.title: Pathogen ID
fields.description: The NCBI Taxonomy identifier for the pathogen.

fields.name: pathogen_species
fields.title: Pathogen species
fields.description: The scientific name of the pathogen.

fields.name: pathogen_strain_id
fields.title: Pathogen strain ID
fields.description: The NCBI Taxonomy identifier at the strain level for each strain of the pathogen. Multiple values are delimited with a semicolon.

fields.name: pathogen_strain
fields.title: Pathogen strain
fields.description: The names of the strain, isolate, subspecies, pathovars, serotypes etc. of the pathogen. Multiple values are delimited with a semicolon.

fields.name: disease
fields.title: Disease
fields.description: The names of any diseases known to be caused by the pathogen. Multiple values are delimited with a semicolon.

fields.name: host_description
fields.title: Host description
fields.description: High-level taxonomic classification for the host species, such as an order or clade.

fields.name: host_id
fields.title: Host ID
fields.description: The NCBI Taxonomy identifier for the host organism.

fields.name: host_species
fields.title: Host species
fields.description: The scientific name of the host organism. The common name of the species (if any) is included in parentheses after the scientific name.

fields.name: host_strain
fields.title: Host strain
fields.example: Hep-G2 cell line; HeLa cell line
fields.description: The name of the strain, cell line, genotype, cultivar, ecotype etc. of the host species. Multiple values are delimited with a semicolon.

fields.name: host_genotype
fields.title: Host genotype
fields.description: Any host genes of interest which are not necessarily tested, but referred to in the publication with regard to the pathogen gene of interest. Multiple values are delimited with a semicolon.

fields.name: host_genotype_id
fields.title: Host genotype ID
fields.description: The unique identifiers for the host genes referred to in the publication. Each identifier is prefixed with with the name of its source database. Multiple values are delimited with a semicolon.

fields.name: tissue
fields.title: Tissue
fields.description: The host tissue where the experiment was initiated. The resulting diseased tissue may be provided in parentheses. Most tissue names follow the naming conventions of the BRENDA Tissue Ontology (BTO). Multiple values are delimited with a semicolon.

fields.name: gene_function
fields.title: Gene function
fields.description: The biological function of the disrupted pathogen gene.

fields.name: go_annotation
fields.title: Gene Ontology annotation
fields.description: List of all appropriate Gene Ontology (GO) terms or Enzyme Commission (EC) numbers for the pathogen gene of interest. GO terms may be followed by a GO evidence code (e.g. IMP). Multiple values are delimited with a semicolon.

fields.name: database
fields.title: Database
fields.description: The name of the source database for records in the 'GO annotation' column.

fields.name: pathway
fields.title: Pathway
fields.description: The name of the pathway that the disrupted pathogen gene is involved in.

fields.name: mutant_phenotype
fields.title: Mutant phenotype
fields.description: Broadly describes a phenotype that results from a pathogen-host interaction, or the response of a pathogen to some chemical.

fields.name: mating_defect
fields.title: Mating defect
fields.description: Whether the experimental pathogen has a mating defect prior to penetrating the host (yes or no). Additional information may be included in parentheses.

fields.name: pre_penetration_defect
fields.title: Pre-penetration defect
fields.description: Whether the experimental pathogen has a pre-penetration defect (yes or no). Additional information may be included in parentheses.

fields.name: penetration_defect
fields.title: Penetration defect
fields.description: Whether the experimental pathogen has a penetration defect (yes or no). Additional information may be included in parentheses.

fields.name: post_penetration_defect
fields.title: Post-penetration defect
fields.description: Whether the experimental pathogen has a post-penetration defect (yes or no). Additional information may be included in parentheses.

fields.name: disease_manifestation
fields.title: Disease manifestation
fields.description: Description of how disease develops during the pathogen-host interaction (at a macroscopic scale).

fields.name: vegetative_spores
fields.title: Vegetative spores
fields.description: Description of the experimental pathogen's vegetative spores.

fields.name: sexual_spores
fields.title: Sexual spores
fields.description: Description of the experimental pathogen's sexual spores.

fields.name: in_vitro_growth
fields.title: In vitro growth
fields.description: Description of how the experimental pathogen grows in vitro.

fields.name: spore_germination
fields.title: Spore germination
fields.description: Description of the experimental pathogen's spore germination process.

fields.name: essential_gene
fields.title: Essential gene
fields.description: Whether a knockout of the pathogen gene is lethal to the pathogen; that is, whether the gene is essential for the in vitro or in vivo growth of the pathogen (yes or no).

fields.name: gene_inducer
fields.title: Gene inducer
fields.description: Chemical substance that can alter metabolic reactions within a cell, tissue, or intact host organism. Multiple values are delimited with a semicolon.

fields.name: gene_inducer_id
fields.title: Gene inducer ID
fields.example: anti-infective: benomyl: CHEBI:3015, CAS:17804-35-2; anti-infective: diethofencarb: CHEBI:4520, CAS:87130-20-9
fields.description: Accession numbers for the inducer chemicals, sourced from ChEBI or the CAS Registry. Accession numbers for each chemical are separated by a semicolon. Where there are multiple accessions for one chemical, the accession numbers are separated by a comma.

fields.name: host_target
fields.title: Host target
fields.description: The first-host-target proteins which interact with the corresponding pathogen protein. May include the host cellular location where the experiment was observed. Multiple values are delimited with a semicolon.

fields.name: host_target_id
fields.title: Host target ID
fields.description: Accession numbers for the host target genes of interest. Each accession number is prefixed with with the name of its source database. Multiple values are delimited with a semicolon.

fields.name: interaction_phenotype
fields.title: Interaction phenotype
fields.description: Description of the interaction phenotype between the pathogen and the host organism.

fields.name: host_response
fields.title: Host response
fields.description: The response observed in the host organism when it interacts with the altered pathogen gene (or protein) of interest.

fields.name: exp_technique_stable
fields.title: Experimental technique (stable)
fields.description: Description of the experimental procedure.

fields.name: exp_technique_transient
fields.title: Experimental technique (transient)
fields.example: Agrobacterium mediated transient expression in tobacco
fields.description: Describes the experimental evidence for a transient assay. Used when the experimental technique is 'functional test in host: transient expression' or 'other evidence'.

fields.name: pmid
fields.title: PubMed ID
fields.description: The PubMed identifier (PMID) for the referenced publication, without the 'PMID:' prefix.

fields.name: reference_source
fields.title: Reference source
fields.description: The name of the library or information resource that contains the referenced publication.

fields.name: doi
fields.title: DOI
fields.description: The Digital Object Identifier for the referenced publication.

fields.name: reference_detail
fields.title: Reference detail
fields.description: The full citation of the referenced publication. May be used as a substitute for a missing PubMed ID or DOI.

fields.name: comments
fields.title: Comments
fields.description: Additional information, e.g. information found only in the abstract of the referenced publication, or information that is not compatible with any other column in the PHI-base database.

fields.name: author_reference
fields.title: Author reference
fields.description: An abbreviated citation for the referenced publication.

fields.name: year
fields.title: Year
fields.description: The year of publication of the referenced publication.

fields.name: curation_date
fields.title: Curation date
fields.description: The date when the referenced publication was curated.
